author: Riley Donovan
description: Commentary Foreign nationals are currently forbidden from buying Canadian houses, so why are they still allowed to buy up our farmland? In January 2023, the federal government banned foreign nationals from purchasing houses in Canada for two years to ensure our domestic housing stock stays in domestic hands. After the two years expired, the ban was […]
title: Canada’s Foreign Buyer Ban Should Include Our Precious Farmland

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Protests in Kenya, Fire at Fireworks Warehouse, and International Rocket Week

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Canada’s Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand and U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio have reaffirmed their alignment on key international issues, including the need to push back against Beijing’s “coercive activity” on the global stage, Rubio says. Rubio made the comments in an Aug. 21 social media post, following a meeting with Anand the same […]
title: Anand, Rubio Agree on Need to Counter China’s ‘Coercive Activity’

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) has issued a recall for a Canadian brand whisky product due to possible glass contamination. Liquor distributor Diageo Canada Inc. has recalled one of Crown Royal Reserve’s Canadian Whisky products due to the “possible presence of glass,” according to an Aug. 19 recall alert posted by the CFIA. The […]
title: Crown Royal Whisky Recalled Due to ‘Possible Presence of Glass’

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney and United States President Donald Trump held a phone conversation for the first time since the July 31 trade deadline passed, Carney says. In an Aug. 21 post on social media, Carney said he had a “productive and wide-ranging conversation” with the U.S. president that morning. “We focused on trade challenges, […]
title: Carney, Trump Talk for First Time Since Trade Deadline Passed

author: Lee Hall
description: Economist and international trade expert Catherine McBride OBE sits down with NTD’s Lee Hall to talk about the British government’s plans for a Brexit reset. McBride asks why a sovereign Britain would want to cede its powers to Europe to make rules for trade, food, and agriculture. She also talks about U.S. President Donald Trump’s […]
title: Brexit ‘Reset’ Would See Europe Making Britain’s Rules Again: Catherine McBride

author: Yeny Sora Robles
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court dismissed U.S. sanctions, ruling that laws or judicial decisions from other countries have no effect in the country without prior approval from the government institutions provided for in the Federal Constitution and Brazilian laws. Justice Flavio Dino of the Supreme Federal Court (STF) suspended the validity of any judicial decisions, laws, decrees, […]
title: Brazilian Judge Rules That Other Countries’ Laws Are Invalid, Dismisses US Sanctions

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The Israeli military has already begun mobilizing 60,000 reservists and the initial steps in a plan to take over Gaza City.
title: Netanyahu Approves Gaza City Takeover Plan, Renewed Hostage Negotiations

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The CEO of the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) has apologized for any “hurt, frustration, or disappointment” caused after the organization dropped a documentary from its upcoming showcase about rescue efforts during the Oct. 7, 2023, Hamas attack on Israel. “I want to apologize for any hurt, frustration, or disappointment that our communication about the […]
title: TIFF CEO Apologizes for ‘Hurt’ Caused by Dropping Hamas Attack Documentary

author: The Canadian Press
description: New court filings show a holding company owned by David Thomson, of Thomson Reuters, wants to buy the royal charter that formed the Hudson’s Bay retailer for at least $15 million and donate it to the Archives of Manitoba. The department store previously announced it would seek court approval next month to sell the charter […]
title: Billionaire David Thomson Interested in Buying Hudson’s Bay Charter, Donating It

author: The Canadian Press
description: Former Quebec premier Lucien Bouchard is advising the leader of the Parti Québécois to reconsider his promise to hold a sovereignty referendum in his first mandate if he becomes premier. The former Bloc Québécois leader and Parti Québécois premier made the comments in a pair of interviews on Radio-Canada on Wednesday. Bouchard says PQ Leader […]
title: Lucien Bouchard Urges Parti Québécois Leader to Reconsider Promise to Hold Referendum

author: Emel Akan
description: The U.S. president blamed the former administration for not letting Ukraine 'fight back.'
title: Trump Says Ukraine Cannot Win War Without Striking Russia

author: Chandra Philip
description: Conservative Party leader Pierre Poilievre says the firing and penalizing of a B.C. nurse for saying “there are only two genders” amounts to “authoritarian censorship.” Last week, the B.C. College of Nurses and Midwives (BCCNM) found nurse Amy Hamm liable of “professional misconduct” over online comments she made on gender issues, ordering her to pay […]
title: Poilievre Says Suspension of BC Nurse for Gender Comments Is ‘Authoritarian Censorship’

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The union representing striking Air Canada flight attendants announced a tentative deal on Aug. 19 and flights began restarting the same day, but for some families, the cancellation of flights during the strike led to disappointment and ruined plans that are too late to fix. Robert Walicki of Sarnia, Ont., says his son, Jan Walicki, […]
title: ‘Tears’ and ‘Disappointment’ as Air Canada Strike Ruined Once-in-a-Lifetime Family Trip

author: Jack Phillips
description: The tribunal issued a statement Wednesday in response to State Department-announced sanctions against four of its officials.
title: UN’s International Criminal Court Says It ‘Strongly Rejects’ New US Sanctions

author: Matthew Horwood
description: A Montreal youth has been arrested on terrorism-related charges after he had allegedly pledged allegiance to the Islamic State and was in the process of planning an attack, the RCMP says. The Mounties said the boy was arrested in the Montreal borough of Côte-des-Neiges–Notre-Dame-de-Grâce on Aug. 20, but did not release his name or age.  […]
title: RCMP Arrest Montreal Boy on Terrorism Charges

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Air Canada is expecting most of its flights to be up and running on Aug. 21, two days after resuming operations following a three-day strike by its flight attendants. The airline expects 98 percent of its domestic flights to operate over the next 24 hours, along with 99 percent of its U.S. flights, and 94 […]
title: Air Canada Set to Operate Most Domestic, International Flights on Aug. 21 as Ramp-Up Continues

author: The Canadian Press
description: The court-appointed monitor overseeing Hudson’s Bay’s creditor protection case says it’s against landlords being forced to accept a B.C. billionaire’s plan to buying more than two dozen of the retailer’s leases. In a new court filing made overnight, Alvarez & Marsal says it does not agree that landlords should be forced to accept Ruby Liu […]
title: Court Monitor Says It Doesn’t Support Hudson’s Bay Plan to Sell Leases to Ruby Liu

author: Guy Birchall
description: The man, named only as Serhii K. due to German privacy laws, is accused of coordinating the September 2022 attack.
title: Ukrainian Arrested in Italy Over Nord Stream Pipelines Attack

author: The Canadian Press
description: A member of the British Columbia legislature says she is pursuing a private prosecution against a Vancouver woman who praised Hamas’s Oct. 7 attack on Israel as “heroic.” Dallas Brodie, leader of the OneBC party, says she has submitted allegations of “terrorism offences” against Charlotte Kates to B.C. provincial court. Kates’ social media accounts list […]
title: BC MLA Launches Private Prosecution Against Charlotte Kates of Samidoun

author: Epoch Video
description: Wildfire rages in Portugal on Aug. 21.
title: REPLAY: Wildfire Rages in Portugal

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Talks continue on further tariff cuts and expanded market access in strategic sectors.
title: US and EU Unveil Trade Deal Details Covering Cars, Pharma, and Semiconductors

author: Yeny Sora Robles
description: U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Christopher Landau responded on Aug. 18 to Venezuelan Minister of Interior and Justice Diosdado Cabello’s recent accusations against him and the U.S. chargé d’affaires in Colombia, John McNamara, regarding alleged actions against Colombia and Venezuela. Cabello spoke on Venezuelan national television on Aug. 13 about McNamara, accusing him of “openly […]
title: Deputy Secretary of State Responds to Venezuelan Minister: ‘History Shows How Tyrants End’

author: Guy Birchall
description: The move comes after the Israel Defense Forces called up around 60,000 more reservists and extended the service of another 20,000.
title: Israel Begins First Steps of Operation to Take Gaza City

author: Alicia Márquez
description: Brad Ross escaped without injury after a four-meter shark broke his board in half off New South Wales.
title: Surfer Survives Close Call With Great White Shark in Australia

author: Chris Summers
description: Retired Lt. Gen. Keith Kellogg has said that U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio is spearheading the effort to draft security guarantees for Ukraine.
title: Zelenskyy Seeks Clarity on Security Guarantees for Ukraine

author: The Associated Press
description: Police officers arrested 18 people at worker-led protests at Microsoft headquarters Wednesday as the tech company promises an “urgent” review of the Israeli military’s use of its technology during the ongoing war in Gaza. Two consecutive days of protest at the Microsoft campus in Redmond, Washington called for the tech giant to immediately cut its […]
title: Microsoft Employee Protests Lead to 18 Arrests as Company Reviews Its Work With Israel’s Military

author: Darlene McCormick Sanchez
description: A new 1 percent remittance tax also goes into effect in January 2026.
title: Money Wired to Mexico Hits a Decade Low as US Immigration Policies Take Hold

author: Savannah Hulsey Pointer
description: The Cambodian nomination followed the U.S. president's assistance in ending Cambodia's recent border conflict with Thailand.
title: 70,000 Cambodian Buddhist Monks Back Nomination of Trump for Nobel Peace Prize

author: Melanie Sun
description: The policy is being implemented ahead of the World Boxing Championships in Liverpool, England.
title: World Boxing to Require Sex Testing for Women’s World Championships

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Most farm equipment doesn't have electric alternatives, and imposing Net Zero obligations on farmers will damage agriculture, the mining magnate says.
title: Net Zero Damages Farming and Raise Food Prices, Gina Rinehart Says

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Electricity demand is rising, with a new report warning of supply shortfalls as coal plants retire before replacements are ready.
title: Report Finds Australia’s Electricity Demand to Rise Sharply Over Next Decade

author: Monica O’Shea
description: In April, Breville announced it would make 'tactical adjustments' to its manufacturing locations in response to the Liberation Day tariffs.
title: Australian Appliance Giant Shifts US-Bound Manufacturing Out of China Amid Trump Tariffs

author: Cindy Li
description: 'Failure to address veteran housing is one of the many endemic system failures contributing to veteran suicide statistics,' said Tamara Paton of Vasey RSL Care.
title: 96 Veterans Have Taken Their Lives Since Royal Commission Report, Inquiry Told

author: Reuters
description: KABUL—An overcrowded bus carrying Afghans expelled from Iran crashed in western Afghanistan and at least 79 people were killed, authorities said on Wednesday. The crash on the Herat-Kabul highway involved a motorcycle, a truck and a bus late on Tuesday, said Ahmdullah Muttaqi, head of the information department for Herat’s provincial government. The bus was […]
title: Bus Collision in Afghanistan Claims 79 Lives

author: Reuters
description: OSINY, Poland—A Russian drone crashed in a field in eastern Poland, according to early findings, Polish officials said on Wednesday, in an incident the nation’s defence minister described as a provocation. The drone hit and scorched a cornfield in the village of Osiny in the eastern Lublin province overnight, over 60 miles from the Ukrainian […]
title: Russian Drone Fell in Eastern Poland, Warsaw Says

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Australia records 1,340 fatalities in 12 months, with pedestrian fatalities up nearly 50 percent since 2021.
title: Road Deaths at 15-Year High Amid Delayed Safety Review

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A campaign to encourage parents to abstain from smartphone use for children is gaining momentum more than a year since it started.
title: Thousands of Parents and Schools Sign Pledge to Delay Children’s Smartphone Use

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The soldier was caught in an undercover operation after he contacted a foreign country asking to defect.
title: NZ Soldier Caught Giving Secrets to What He Thought Was a Foreign Power

author: Jacob Burg
description: 'I think that we should expect, and [President Donald Trump] certainly expects, Europe to play the leading role here,' said U.S. Vice President JD Vance.
title: Europe Expected to Provide ‘Lion’s Share’ of Security Guarantees for Ukraine, Vance Says

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: French Minister for Overseas Manuel Valls is in New Caledonia trying to shore up support for an all-party agreement that promised to end years of conflict.
title: France Sends Minister to New Caledonia in Bid to Rescue Peace Plan

author: Dorothy Li
description: The United States received about 619 tons of magnets last month, a surge from just 46 tons in May.
title: China’s Rare Earth Shipments to US Jump After Trade Truce

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: 'You put your trust in a system, and that system let you down,' the premier said.
title: Victoria Commits to 22 Childcare Safety Reforms After Urgent Review

author: Chandra Philip
description: A Nova Scotia man has filed a legal challenge to the provincial prohibition against going into the woods and a $28,000 ticket he received deliberately for not following it. The province announced restrictions on activities in forested areas as of Aug. 5, saying that hot and dry conditions “greatly increased” the risk of wildfires. The […]
title: NS Man Files Legal Challenge Against Provincial Forest Ban, $28,000 Fine

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre says that while his party advocates for the rule of law, he supports Air Canada workers receiving fair compensation and argued the Liberal government should have backed Tory legislation to ensure they are paid for all hours worked.” His comments come as the union representing Air Canada flight attendants ended its […]
title: Poilievre Says Tories Support ‘Law and Order’ but Air Canada Flight Attendants Deserve Fair Compensation

author: Alfred Bui
description: Chris Keefer was also concerned that the renewable transition is preventing Western countries from taking smart measures to reduce carbon emissions.
title: Nuclear Advocate Warns Net Zero Leads to Massive Misallocation of Funds
